{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2965304,"name":"Daniel","username":"CorruptedConsistency","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/corruptedconsistency/{size}/159201_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-15T22:13:31.208Z","cooked":"

My team knows how to do CAD with SolidWorks, but we struggle to design with good ideas. In other words, we have the ability to design most things for which we have ideas, but we aren‚Äôt able to come up with good design choices on our robot. As far as I know, there aren‚Äôt any good official guides or resources on good choices made by other teams for previous years. Does anyone have any suggestions of where to look for such resources?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-15T22:13:31.208Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":24,"reads":384,"readers_count":383,"score":196.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"Daniel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49338,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2965306,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-15T22:28:09.828Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm slightly unclear on what specifically you‚Äôre asking, so bear with me for a moment.

Are you asking 1) what sorts of mechanisms do teams use for Task X, how do they compare with each other, and what are the pitfalls, or 2) why do teams choose to use X mechanism?

I‚Äôm going to tell you that there ARE guides, for both questions actually. I can‚Äôt recall exactly where they‚Äôre at right now, but here‚Äôs a couple of places to start:
‚Äìsearch this site for ‚Äú254 Technical Binder‚Äù.
‚Äì@AllenGregoryIV 's team has the ‚ÄúSpectrum Series‚Äù that may help.
‚ÄìThe Compass Alliance probably has something‚ÄìI‚Äôm not as familiar with that resource. (@Michael_Corsetto for more details)
‚ÄìThere‚Äôs a lot more resources out there, just takes some searching. I suggest restricting the category to ‚ÄúCD-Media‚Äù when searching this site‚Äìyou‚Äôll probably find a few papers on the topic.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-15T22:28:09.828Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":378,"readers_count":377,"score":100.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/2","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965307,"name":"Jim Forbes","username":"MrForbes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrforbes/{size}/165505_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-15T22:28:48.638Z","cooked":"

Learn from what top teams do‚Ä¶learn from your mistakes‚Ä¶and most importantly, interate, continuously, and don‚Äôt settle for a design that doesn‚Äôt work excellently

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-15T22:28:48.638Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":351,"readers_count":350,"score":125.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"Jim Forbes","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/3","custom_user_title":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965309,"name":"Mark Wasserman","username":"Mark_Wasserman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_wasserman/{size}/9677_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-16T00:05:13.123Z","cooked":"

Copy the best, design the rest.

Do the homework. Study the white papers. Study other robots. Watch lots of video. Etc. If you feel you can better said idea, great.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-16T00:08:53.680Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":314,"readers_count":313,"score":127.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"Mark Wasserman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30473,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly"},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/4","custom_user_title":"Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965310,"name":"","username":"Ben_Martin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ben_martin/{size}/213340_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-16T00:29:33.560Z","cooked":"

A lot of teams struggle with this, and even those of us with more experience plotting out effective robot ‚Äòarchitecture‚Äô have room for improvement every year. This is ultimately just institutional FRC knowledge / experience making good FRC judgment calls you need to develop, so there are a couple things you can do:

  • Watch a ton of match video of the teams you want to be like
  • Make very good friends with a top team / spend lots of time with them to get experience in their day-to-day and at events
  • Attend a lot of offseasons, redesign your robot after the season to make it more like the teams that did well the prior year and play with it at those offseasons
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-16T00:29:33.560Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":300,"readers_count":299,"score":125.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6001,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965312,"name":"Harper Elizabeth Nalley","username":"Harper.Nalley.4915","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/harper.nalley.4915/{size}/145349_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-16T01:30:03.668Z","cooked":"

Honestly, study designs. Look at robots en masse, look at what designs worked and which ones didnt, compare them, look at the similarities and look at the differences, and from there try to extrapolate why a design worked where, say, a similar design didnt. Basically try to collect so much data so that you can eliminate variables

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-16T01:30:03.668Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":84.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"Harper Elizabeth Nalley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46757,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CAD & Design Lead"},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/6","custom_user_title":"CAD & Design Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965315,"name":"UnofficialForth","username":"UnofficialForth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unofficialforth/{size}/167902_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-16T02:21:15.712Z","cooked":"

Don‚Äôt try to CAD the final thing in one go. I highly suggest using the agile methodology. Let each iteration expose flaws and faults with the design. With each new sprint, adjust your designs to better solve the problem.

image1752√ó814 170 KB

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-16T02:21:15.712Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":254,"readers_count":253,"score":60.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"UnofficialForth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/7/5/75062b7b12deb0d4640f0cc9980699d88e01bcee.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29982,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee"},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/7","custom_user_title":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965317,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-16T03:19:41.330Z","cooked":"

Don‚Äôt forget the excellent NASA RAP document:
https://robotics.nasa.gov/nasa-rap-robotics-design-guide/

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-16T03:19:41.330Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":235,"readers_count":234,"score":187.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://robotics.nasa.gov/nasa-rap-robotics-design-guide/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"NASA RAP Robotics Design Guide ‚Äì Robotics Alliance Project","clicks":20}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965318,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-16T03:31:00.913Z","cooked":"

If you have promising ideas internally, great! If not (or even if you do), there are plenty of good design resources out there, from FRC teams, from RI3D teams, from non FRC sources, some of which are linked above. The toughest ‚Äúhow do we even start on this‚Äù I remember was how to launch a Frisbee for Ultimate Ascent (3946‚Äôs second year). FRC teams had never attacked this problem before, and we weren‚Äôt aware of RI3D, 2013 being its first year, and there was only one. We found a number of solutions online, though. None of the ones we could find would fit in our frame perimeter, but we were able to examine a few and reverse engineer the key thing - spinning the Frisbee horizontally for the gyroscopic stabilization. Once we figured that out and tried to fit it in the frame perimeter, we were already designing something that looked rather like the RI3D launcher. Soon after, someone found the RI3D video and we ordered some pneumatic wheels [Today I‚Äôd do compliant rubber wheels!]. We tweaked and tuned on that basic design, adjusting speeds, inflation, and adding Teflon bars in the launcher until we were consistently hitting a box that was about 1/3 as tall and 1/5 as wide as the goal, meaning that hitting the goal was pretty much a given. Our final solution included Lego parts (to serialize Frisbees), spacers (inserted in the launcher to constrain the flight path), and a system to push the Frisbee into the wheels that was able to push on the inside of the leading edge of the Frisbee, but deflect easily when it met the trailing edge of the Frisbee. If we had done all of this a week or two faster, we would have discovered the jamming mechanism that didn‚Äôt show up until competition.

MrForbes:

most importantly, interate,

Let me take this to the next level: Fail Faster. Develop a nominal system quickly, and exercise it early and often to figure out when and where it fails. Then you know what your next iteration needs to fix. The faster you fail, the more cycles you have to improve.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-16T03:38:04.438Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":51.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú "},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/9","custom_user_title":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965319,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-08-16T04:09:38.622Z","cooked":"

It all starts with the team getting brutally honest and understanding what it‚Äôs capabilities are in terms of what it knows how to design, what sort of mechanisms they can execute well using the resources and time they have available and choosing a game strategy that stays within those constraints. Often, to stay within those constraints, teams will have to choose less ambitious goals in the roles they choose to play in the game so that they can execute those roles at a high level of proficiency. In the off-season, they can choose to expand their knowledge and experience by tackling mechanisms they have not been successful with in the past.

When ‚Äúcopying a design‚Äù, one shouldn‚Äôt aim to produce something that looks like the successful design since this will often leave out many of the elements of the design that made it successful. One should study the successful designs with the aim to produce something that works as well as the successful design. This requires a lot of time and deep thinking to extract those elements that make a design successful.

To gain knowledge, many have already suggested studying materials that teams publish (white papers, CAD, engineering notebooks, etc.). I have found speaking directly with team members who did the development work to be highly valuable. For instance, the CAD models that many teams publish contains no information relating to why they chose those designs and the manufacturing processes and techniques that are necessary to make that design successful. This makes it difficult to copy a design.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-16T04:09:38.622Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":91.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965320,"name":"sanddrag","username":"sanddrag","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-08-16T04:12:37.525Z","cooked":"

A lot of teams use CAD for the first step in design, which I think is a mistake. I see it more as a last step. The first step is a discussion, followed by some sketches on a whiteboard with dry erase pens, then a calculator, then CAD. Sprinkle in cardboard and prototyping anywhere you like.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2021-08-16T04:12:37.525Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":80.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":395550,"topic_slug":"top-level-design","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/top-level-design/395550/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2965323,"name":"Mike Corsetto","username":"Michael_Corsetto","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/michael_corsetto/{size}/126012_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-16T04:29:17.446Z","cooked":"

Hey Daniel,

Lots of smart, experienced folks sharing ideas in this thread.

There are few shortcuts to ‚Äúgood FRC design‚Äù. Some best practices will help you focus more time on the things that really matter. Some of my fall workshop videos go into these shortcuts.

Beyond that, you and your team just have to practice, year over year.

If it was easy, everyone would be doing it.

-Mike
